comments:
Every time I start Eclipse (using the launcher installed to /usr/lib/eclipse/eclipse) I get the following message:

"An error has occurred. See the log file /home/doug/workspace/.metadata/.log."

I'm running Ubuntu 6.10 (edgy eft) on a Core 2 duo (x86_64) computer.  The error occurs even when eclipse is run as root (done unintentionally after installation). I have tried re-installing Eclipse and Java with no success. The java version I am using is listed here (as the output of java -version):

java version "1.5.0_08"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_08-b03)
Java HotSpot(TM) 64-Bit Server VM (build 1.5.0_08-b03, mixed mode)

Looks strange.  We should be able to find memmove().

I was able to run Eclipse 3.2.1 on x64.

Try the following steps:

1. Make a new directory for the download it and move it there.
2. tar -xzvf eclipse-SDK-3.2.1-linux-gtk-x86_64.tar.gz
3. cd eclipse
4. ./eclipse -vm [path to your 64 JRE]/jre/bin/java &

Marking as WORKSFORME. Please reopen if you are still having trouble.

I'm using the "Synaptic Package Manager" to install instead of downloading the tar file from eclipse.org if that makes a difference.  I ran

./eclipse -vm /usr/lib64/j2se/1.4/jre/bin/java

which did not work, so I tried

/usr/lib64/jvm/java-1.5.0-sun-1.5.0.08/jre/bin

which didn't work either, so I then tried

./eclipse -vm /usr/lib64/jvm/java-1.4.2-gcj-4.1-1.4.2.0/jre/bin/java

which again didn't work, each time seeing the splash screen then receiving an Eclipse dialog box informing me that:

"An error has occurred. See the log file
/home/doug/workspace/.metadata/.log."

which I had previously posted and can post again if wanted.  Perhaps there is a conflict between the different jre's... I don't know.

2 important things here: 

1. Make sure you are running a the 64 bit version of Eclipse (download the right one from eclipse.org). You want the Linux (x86_64/GTK 2) build and *not* the Linux (ia64/GTK 2) build.

2. Make sure you are running a 64 bit JRE. From what I could see, it looks like JRE 5 is the first Sun supported Linux x64 JRE (ie. your 1.4 won't work). We never run with gcj. I suggest downloading the the Linux x64 Platform JRE from Sun (either version JRE5 update 11 or JRE6 update 1).

I just wanted to add that you should get the Sun JRE 6 update 1, as someone else mentioned having problems using Sun 5_11 on x64. Please let me know if this is working for you so I can close this bug.

Since it worked for you, I suspect that the Synaptic Package Manager is not installing the x64 version, and that is probably the problem.  I have uninstalled java 1.4 and gcj and am downloading the new x64 Eclipse version (3.2.2).  When it is finished I will try it and let you know if it works.  I can re-open the bug if I still can't get it to work with JRE 6 and eclipse x64.
I was able to run Eclipse 3.2.1 on x64 after downloading it from eclipse.org.  I guess I'll have to submit a bug on the Synaptic Package Manager. Thanks for all your help.
Thanks for getting back to us.
